availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, farmer. Tennessee native. Son of Michael Elijah Dycus. Married to Sabre Pickett Dycus in Wayne County, Tennessee, in 1831. Father of Mary E. Dycus, Elizabeth Dycus, Mary Louise Dycus, Jane Paralee Dycus, William Thomas Dycus, Joseph Dycus, and Henry Dycus. Farmer in Ballard County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Ballard County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, p. 262B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Picketts District, p. 601.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, District No. 8, p. 511B.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 17254.
Dick Barclay, Graveyards in Carlisle & Hickman County, Kentucky, (Arlington, KY: Dick Barclay, 1974), p. 9.
